p: It is well known that the innate immunity is the fist line of host defense against pathogens. When a host is infected with the virus, a class of antiviral signaling molecules is immediately triggered, enhancing specific signal transduction cascades, initiating the inherent antiviral immune response, and ultimately eliminating the virus by producing necessary effector molecules, such as IFNs, interleukin, ISGs, and so on [ 24, 25].
